reviewText: What does it mean, to be alive?  On a biological level this can be answered easily, but it becomes harder to answer as we approach it more philosphically.  Is life not constructed of the same matter as the rest of the universe?  Does a dead body not have the same amount of atoms as a living body?  Can you measure the soul?  Is sentience, nay, is consciousness something a living being can truly attain?  In the face of the infinite void of the universe, can a human claim to know anything at all?  Can a human truly understand anything, or is all of our culture and history nothing more than the filthy residue of our species' unending drive to eat, ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, and kill?  Can any man claim to be superior to another man, to an ape, a goat, a snake, an ant?  Should we as a species be proud of our dominance over the Earth?  Have we, through our actions, proven to be noble and gracious caretakers of the only home we have?  I think not.  No, a man is nothing more than an unthinking beast with ersatz free will.  Mankind is a nuclear wolf wearing the skin of God, barking at itself in the mirror in a locked room full of its own excrement. Barking louder and louder, bared fangs slobbering radioactive saliva, until it's idiotic madness causes it's own heart to detonate.\n\nIt is time to remove the mask of yourself.  Rip away the insincere facade of humanity from your ego.  Your leg is caught in the beartrap of society, and if you don't gnaw your leg off your spirit will starve to death.  Become the beast you already know you should be, deep down inside, and the taste in your mouth won't be your own blood, it will be the taste of freedom.  Play Goat Simulator.

reviewText:
This is a fun game with a lot of laughs, but they don't last very long.

I personally dislike resorting to downloading workshop content for extra things to work with in game, you may disagree but the content Goat Simulator offers is very little. The music and background don't really interest me at all, other than finding new things to explode or faff about with.

My favorite thing about this game would be the Ludicrous physics and insane amount of laughs that again, don't last long without the workshop. Other than that nothing stands out. Maybe it's because I haven't played the game enough but this is all I have to say for now.

4/10

reviewText: Since their inception, computer and video games have both fascinated and caused great fear in the politicians, educators, academics, and the public at large. In the United States, this fear and fascination goes back to the early 1980s, when Ronald Reagan extolled the virtues of games to create a generation of highly skilled cold war warriors, The United States Army's Task Force XXI program (TF-XXI), also known as the Next-Generation Integrated Infantry Fighting System, was a series of trial exercises and initiatives conducted by the U.S. Army, in the interest of modernization. The goal was to test unique concepts, tactics, and technologies on the modern-day battlefield. The exercises involved virtual reality training for selected soldiers during the late 1990s, but it is said to have been under research and development since the 1980s. Some of the technology that was tested includes software-defined radios, digital transmitters installed on all their weapons, appliqu√© computers carried by each soldier (to minimize casualties and maximize combat effectiveness by sharing data), ground surveillance radar, satellite radio e-mail systems, and unmanned combat aerial vehicles. Members of this division also had some degree of access to top secret development projects in the military.\n\nThe impact of digital games on learning and behavior, as conceptualized through researchers in the military and indeed the learning sciences communities is an important, but frequently overlooked area of games studies. My hope is that in the upcoming months, discussions around gaming and cognition will draw upon research in the learning sciences and possible military applications of videogames such as Goat Simulator.

reviewText:
If you came here for a review great, but if you want a really good pie recipe here it is:
Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing

reviewText:
Every few years a game comes around, a game with wisdom, knowledge, redemption. With a story so thought provoking and intense you cannot help but cry a bit. A game that turns boys into men and girls into women. A game that sets the bar for future generations of games. Games like Super Mario Bros, Doom, Final Fantasy, and now Goat Simulator.

‚Ä¶.. ok not really but it is a game about being a goat and you get to go destroy things, so it's still pretty awesome. Just finished my first run through (and trust me I ran through a lot of stuff XD) and I enjoyed it, for something so silly it is surprisingly fun. A lot of hidden things to find and hidden jokes if you take the time to look around. And you can always reset the world and try destroying things differently. Not to mention it has workshop support so who knows what the community will add.  If you want a fun crazy goat related experience that you can play over and over just go ahead and slap down 10 bucks and enjoy yourself, after all you may be a goat in your next life better be prepared!*

*(Reincarnation is not necessarily the belief of the reviewer, nor is he saying that this is in fact true or false. However for purposes of a joke he has put it in.)

reviewText:
Quite possibly the best goat simulator I've ever played, no seriously!

But seriously, remember back in the old days, when games were fun. We just played...for fun, spending hours playing certain games with no MP features just because they were great fun to play. These days, most games fail hardly at meeting that demand, half the time the games we play these days are MP, and we only do so to `get to the next level` or `unlock the next item` or we paly them simply because our friends are playing them.

This game is unique, it succesfully fills that cliche of just being a thing to play on your own, for fun!

However that said, there are some negatives. The map feels small, and the current stuff to do is fairly limiting. Providing the game gets updated with little bits of content from the workshop or the devs, I'm sure this game will continue to thrive, and remain my favourite 15 minute time killer.

Also, the lack of being able to eat grass and poop is disturbing for a goat simulator. Please add that one!!

Kog

reviewText:
This game is honestly the biggest buyer's remorse I've ever had fo a game. It's funny... For five minutes. I'd bought it for about ¬£7 and spent ten minutes on it before getting bored. The controls are pretty terrible. It's a pain trying to control the goat and get it to do what you want it to. The game itself is also pretty glitchy.

The joke wears thin very fast, which is the game's main selling point. I mean, there's only so many times you can watch a goat blow up. The worst thing about it is the price. In no way is this game worth ¬£7. This is the most I've spent on a game on Steam (I'm not a heavy PC gamer) and it's the only game I feel I've wasted money on.

I don't really recommend this game at all but if you desperately must try it, please don't spend over ¬£3 for it.

reviewText:
BEST PARKOUR GAME IN YEARS.

Goat simulator is a must-buy if you're bored. (and have ten bucks you dont care about spending)

It has one of the funniest physics I've ever seen and you can do pretty much anything you want. I reccomend playing with friends, it will almost quadruple the amounts of laughs you get otherwise. Its a sandbox game, there is no end so it's no surprise if you get bored after a week (or less, depends on what kind of person you are). Trying to get higher scores, finding easter eggs and trying to get all the achievements always leaves you wanting to play somemore.

And the Acrobatics/Parkour mechanics are SO much fun. jump from roof to roof, wall climb, wall jump, do 360-backflips, and walk on your front legs. Its so challenging and fun to run across the maps parkouring on everything, even vehicles.

But If you're worried that it will only provide you with a very short amount of entertainment and dont want to spend more money buying the DLCs, you can download mods and maps people made on the steam workshop! (or even make mods)

This game is a masterpiece to be honest.

Basically, Goat Simulator is a low-budget (yet amazing) GTA-like indie game by Coffee Stain Studios. If the devs are reading this, know that I love ya'll and support your amazing work! (especially Mikael!)

10/10, Definitely worth the 10 bucks. buy it. Don't buy hoola-hoops or bricks.

reviewText: Gaze upon this masterpiece, my friends, as it is the apex of humanity's development; all that was created and destroyed in this feeble and near paltry timeline of our existence has led up to the conception of this game. With this shockingly accurate and magnificent simulation of the daily endeavors of the goat, we have acquired the ability to now witness their mysterious lives. Although we are unable to fathom the true power the goats possess, and that the take-over the goats are planning is inevitable and we will all surely perish, we are able to sit back and marvel at this beast and its qualities.\n\nFor on that day
date: the Goat had arisen above all else
recommended: and had emerged victorious with their enemies blood on its glitched neck and its prestige etched within its Anti-Gravity Room Overflow-Integer Stunt Combo. Nothing was standing in its way to greatness
hoursPlayed: and nothing ever would."\n\nBless this game."

reviewText:
Although you may know how to talk the talk and walk the walk... BUT can you goat the goat?

Goat Simulator is a game of adventure, love, heartbreak, suspense, murder, and any other type of genre you can think of. You play as an indebted detective known as Bookshelf DeGoat sent on a mission by the iconic lettuce triplets to bring them the girl and wipe away the debt. You jump in a rocket and fly up to the floating haven (and by haven I mean sweat shop) of Alaska. Once there you will begin to notice the high amounts of patriotism and overpriced T-shirts manufactured by Starbucks. You learn about their leader, Celery Q. Cumquat, you enter a raffle then win only to find out you are known as the False Sheep. You fight hordes and hordes of Cumquat's men to reach the girl known as Goatlizabeth. As the duo run around the city of Alaska Goatlizabeth is shown to have supernatural powers to open ripples in space-time simply referred to as tears.

I could go on about the plot but I won't spoil the rest of it for you. All I can say is that this is the greatest entry in Baashock franchise yet.

Goat out of twelve-ty two would most certainly bang

Goat
Of
The
Year

reviewText:
This game is a gem. The developers are completely open and honest: this game is broke beyond repair, everything glitches, things don't work, the physics are absurd and I LOVE IT. For 9.99 I have enjoyed this game 10 times more than the last game I bought for the full retail 59.99 (which was Lego Marvel on PS4). It is so refreshing to just have a game to play in, have a silly time with, and just see what you can get away with doing. The developers obviously had a blast making this game and it really shows; every little aspect has a sort of juvenile humor about it that just feels human, instead of cookie cutter, corporately censored forced dialogue and story that AAA titles have fallen into.

Yes it's buggy, yes it's glitchy, yes it's pretty atrocious in the graphical fidelity department.. but dear god it is the most fun thing I've played since discovering the GECK for Fallout :D

Give this game a chance, you'll love it!

reviewText:
Alright, so this my first time reviewing a game on Steam, and I felt I had to do it because this game is really awesome. It's huge in every sense of the word - long, hard (that's what she said :P) and has a level of freedom you wouldn't expect from a game more than ten years old. You can do pretty much everything you want - sleep, grill meat, forge weapons, make potions, skin animals and take their teeth and even smoke pot and sell it for profit - and go anywhere you want in the game's world without a quest asking you to go there.
The sun rises and sets, NPC sleep, wake up, work, gather to talk with each other, etc. etc.
Being a simulator, the development of the character is always important in such a genre, and Goat simulator really shines in that department. You start as a poor weakling who gets beaten up by everyone and hardly can kick harmless little creatures called meatbugs. Then, as you complete quests and defeat enemies, you gain XP which can be converted in strength, dexterity and mana points. You go all the way to a badass warrior, a lethal ranger or a supreme mage - you chose how you want to play it.
As for the bad parts, I just can think of one: the game is VERY buggy, and that can totally ruin your game experience if you don't know how to avoid it.

A few important considerations about the game if you want to play and enjoy it:

- Steam doesn't provide a game manual for Goat sim, and that truly sucks. If there are some games which you can start playing without reading the manual first - most modern games carry in-game tutorials - this is NOT one of them. The controls are a bit akward and if you don't read about them first I guarantee you won't be able to play the game at all. Just visit the Steam community page and you'll easily find a link to download the official manual in PDF.

- You can and you SHOULD run the game on Windows 7. My desktop computer is a Pentium IV with Windows XP, and I thought It would be better choice for this game to avoid system compatibility issues. Well, that was a mistake. The game kept crashing anywhere between 5 and 30 minutes of gameplay, especially when facing multiple foes, not to mention some inventory items didn't even show the picture. I googled it and updated all my Nvidia and sound card drivers, but the problems aforementioned remained unchanged. I was very close to quit playing the game at all, but I thought what the heck, let me try it on my laptop which runs on W 7. It got A LOT better. It only crashed about 10% of the time (ah ah), especially during the first visit to the Sleeper's temple (be sure to save a lot there) and the inventory issue got fixed. I don't know about Vista or 8, but the game seems to like Windows 7. Oh, and make sure to disable Steam interface during gameplay, or the game might not start at all.

- The game allows you to save whenever you want, so make sure you take advantage of it. I suggest this not for cheating purposes, but to avoid losing your game progress due to a crash or even worse, some bug where a gate doesn't open when it was supposed to or you end up killing NPCs vital to the plot who shouldn't be allowed to die at that point of the game.

- Get a walkthrough. I suggest the one by JemyM, which you can easily find online. Again, I recommend it not for cheating (you can even skip the walkthrough part per se) but for the unvaluable information it contains regarding gameplay and common bugs and how to avoid them.

- Go to a place like steamcommunity.com and download the map pictures. Trust me, you will need them.

- If you're more into action games, maybe this game is not for you. Through most part of the game (especially the first chapters), you keep running from place to place around the colony, doing chores for other people, looking for objects, etc. Sure, later you'll feel like an invencible killing machine - it felt VERY rewarding going back to the Old Camp and slaughtering all those ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•s who mugged me in the beginning :P - but it takes a while to get there. Play this game for the RPG experience and the story, and you will enjoy it.

I was very close to quit playing the game at all, but I thought what the heck, let me try it on my laptop which runs on W 7. It got A LOT better. It only crashed about 10% of the time (ah ah), especially during the first visit to the Sleeper's temple (be sure to save a lot there) and the inventory issue got fixed. I don't know about Vista or 8, but the game seems to like Windows 7. Oh, and make sure to disable Steam interface during gameplay, or the game might not start at all.

- The game allows you to save whenever you want, so make sure you take advantage of it. I suggest this not for cheating purposes, but to avoid losing your game progress due to a crash or even worse, some bug where a gate doesn't open when it was supposed to or you end up killing NPCs vital to the plot who shouldn't be allowed to die at that point of the game.

- Get a walkthrough. I suggest the one by JemyM, which you can easily find online. Again, I recommend it not for cheating (you can even skip the walkthrough part per se) but for the unvaluable information it contains regarding gameplay and common bugs and how to avoid them.

- Go to a place like steamcommunity.com and download the map pictures. Trust me, you will need them.

- If you're more into action games, maybe this game is not for you. Through most part of the game (especially the first chapters), you keep running from place to place around the colony, doing chores for other people, looking for objects, etc. Sure, later you'll feel like an invencible killing machine - it felt VERY rewarding going back to the Old Camp and slaughtering all those ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•s who mugged me in the beginning :P - but it takes a while to get there. Play this game for the RPG experience and the story, and you will enjoy it.

reviewText: Goat Simulator's purpose is to entertain the player by any means. This meant removing ony crash bugs because the bugs made people chuckle, allowing the player to break the game, making advanced physics calculations such as turning the goat's neck into spaghetti, and the list goes on. Its sole purpose is to be worth its $10 by making the player ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• himself/herself in laughter. From going down a waterslide in ragdoll, to going to space, to latching onto a hillbilly's car with your tongue and clotheslining innocent bystanders, to blowing up a gas station. The entertainment is endless, and the game gives you enough activities to do. Also, you can become a demon goat, get a baseball launcher, and get a jetpack(from what I've discovered so far).\nIn case you didn't read any of this, you can be a goat and make your neck spaghetti. So 8/10.

reviewText:
I know I'm gonna get flack for this review, but this is how I honestly feel about it:

While funny at first, the novelty runs out quick.
Yeah I get it, I'm a goat. I do random things. I can ragdoll. I can attack and lick people.
There's silly captions and weird WTF moments.

While it produces quite a few laughs at first, this novelty runs out the first hour or two you play the game.
Once you do all the gags and see all the silly captions, it starts to lose interest - like watching the same Family Guy episode, over and over and over on a non-stop loop.


It's not a BAD game; but the novelty eventually dies and then you kinda move on.

reviewText:
Well. For the first couple of hours of this game. It's a lot better than I initially expected.
So far I've:
-Sacrificed humans to the satanic goat lord, therefore become a flying devil goat that can suck in people with giant demon balls.
-Put a beacon on a crop circle, and then get launched into space, floating around for eternity.
-Climbed the magnificant goat tower, of the whole 2 stories. Walking into the top hatch I'd figured I'd be teleported into a gigantic castle, which to my suprise contained several goats bowing down to me as I passed. Once I stepped up onto my throne, I was teleported back into the normal world, which I could make it rain goats at will.
-Played flappy goat on a TV, >the pain tho
-Saw a nice happy party going on. Saw a boulder. Rolled the boulder down onto the party completely ruining it.
-Found the 'Goat Henge' and played dominos.
10/10
Amazing game. Completely reccommend it.

reviewText:
Do you want to succeed in life but procrastination keeps getting in your way? Buy Lag Simulator!

From the developer Coffee Stain Studios comes the wonderful game Lag Simulator! This piece of brilliance is sure to make all of your goals in life to come to fruition.
Many people suffer from a lack of will or horrible procrastination and so cannot get themselves to do anything with their lives but to stay at home and game, hiding behind the safe veil of their screen.
And that is where Lag Simulator comes in to save the day!
This game will create such an immense lag on your pc or laptop that you can‚Äôt do anything at all but stare at your screen! Yes, that‚Äôs right: only staring at your screen! And that‚Äôs when you‚Äôre still at the menu! I‚Äôve played this game for 75 minutes and all of that time was spent waiting for the game to actually start! How lag! Truly a wonderful piece of art!

Needless to say, I‚Äôve never had more fun playing a game.

However, staring blankly at my unmoving screen gave me a certain feeling.. A feeling of productivity.  Odd, I know!  But during those 75 minutes of Lag Simulator I got inspired..  Scary, yes.  Inspired to do something. And since my screen wasn‚Äôt working (nor anything else since Lag Simulator lags the whole system!) I decided to do something with my life!
So passionately (Yes, passion! ) I began reading once again. I now know how to better massage people with oils and special techniques and all that. All of this thanks to Lag Simulator!
I, for one, recommend buying Lag Simulator if you really want to succeed in life!

For anyone not yet convinced to buy this superb game, take a look at what the developer said about it on their site:
‚ÄúLag Simulator is a small, broken and stupid game. It was made in a couple of weeks so don‚Äôt expect a game in the size and scope of GTA with goats. In fact, you‚Äôre better off not expecting anything at all actually. To be completely honest, it would be best if you‚Äôd spend your $10 on a hula hoop, a pile of bricks, or maybe a real-life goat.‚Äù

Apparently Lag Simulator has goats too. Who knew?

reviewText:
Goat Simulator is one big joke. But a hilarious one, even if it's for an hour. Play as a glitchy, buggy goat and headbutt and run into everyone and everything you see, all the while trying to create the biggest combo you can. The game itself is also very buggy and glitchy so don't expect anything to happen your way. It's random. It's hilarious.

The graphics look surprisingly good and there's a good amount of activity and variety available in the map, but you'll probably get bored within a few hours. But, you should give it a try anyway.

reviewText:
I play many types of simulation games. I'm a huge fan of ARMA, realistic flight sims and naval warfare sims.

So, you can take my word that this is one of the most well researched simulations I have ever played. I now know the experience of being a goat.
It's a shame that some people will discount this game as not being realistic enough. They prefer to have goat uniform inspections and to take 30 minutes acquiring their gear in order to goat up.
I say nay to these goat ropers. You should spend some time with real goats. They do not say their names and goat ranks before entering an APC. They simply enter.
You will know true fear when you look a goat in their weird rectangular pupils.
10/10

This game is not as fun as everyone makes it sound.

Initially i thought this is a small little sandbox you can turn on and enjoy with friends for an hour when you have time to kill. It is not even that.
I found no fun in aimlessly running around, bugging out rag dolls and exploding stuff for no reason at all. Bugs presented as fun feature in this game are found in almost every game - accompanied by an actual fun gameplay experience.

Also I experienced strong motion sickness within an hour. I don't know if this was due to the severe performance issues - the game seems to not detect the powerful of my 2 video cards - or due to some other stuff going on... i did not enjoy this game at all.

reviewText: I'm not even sure whether to recommend this game or not. I understand that the main goal of this game are open world havoc for fun. There're a lot of silly effects and you can do funny things. But I didn't get the fun. I'm totally bored with the game, and it gets worst with the MMO Simulator update.I understand that they're trying to add something to do in-game rather than just pointlessly creating ruckus in the middle of the town. I guess that's just because there's nothing to do ? I'm not the achievement kind of guy. I don't really care about pursuing achievements since it gives you nothing. The graphics are okay, the gameplay is rather pointless, and I think the game's effort to give me fun is a huge fail. I saw a lot of positive reviews from other people and most of them don't play for long. This game is best fit to fill your free time when you're bored playing anything. But if you're also bored of crazy goats,walking toilets and two-legged microwave, this game will become totally useless.\n\nNote : Please,people.Do not give thumbs down to my review only because I didn't recommend your beloved game.Everyone has their right to express their opinion about the game in the review section.Remember the thumbs up or down is about whether my review is HELPFUL or NOT.It's not about whether I recommend a game you like or not.What's the point of rating my review if you love the game ? Why are you reading reviews if you love the game ? Why do you even read reviews when you ALREADY have the game ? I suppose a lot of people intentionally giving thumbs down because they hate people who aren't recommending a game they like.Maybe they're trying to cover up the bads of the game ? My review is for the people who don't know what kind of game is this and I want to help them to decide whether to buy this game or not.THAT is the purpose of a review.I truly hope you people are educated enough to comprehend this and STOP giving bad ratings to reviews that don't recommend a game you like.

reviewText:
The most beautifully immersive game I've ever played. Running around licking cars is everybody's dream. And this game lets you live it. This game is life itself personified and moreso. I had no life until I had a Goat Simulator.

This game is truly limitless, if not for its authentic goat noises to the ability to run off the map without spazzing out everywhere and teleporting to a random place with a glitched neck. It has a little bit that caters for everyone.

My favourite part of Goat Simulator is I can finally achieve my lifelong goal of becoming a goat. I can feel the light on my furry nostrils as my devil horns rule over my sacrifices. I can become the tall goat of the Savannah, never before discovered or named quite so fondly.

Although it is not quite the same as putting my hooves on daily and experiencing first hand my goatish complexion, Goat Simulator establishes the balance between reality and goats. Indicating there truly is a goat within us all. For the human race is born goats.
This game has made me a better person.

Amen.

reviewText: Goat Simulator is the latest in hircine emulation technology by developer Coffee Stain Studios, who you may remember as the developers of the not-so-goatish Sanctum games. The game is, as far as I can tell, the premium representation of farm life, in terms of goats, and shows the perfect flow of the life-cycle of the goat itself; doing stunts off of explosive cars is just an example of such things you can experience in this third-person open-world goat-em-up.\n\nAll jokes aside, Goat Simulator is a collaborative effort by the guys at Coffee Stain which takes pride in it's stupendous outrageousness, your goat can get a jetpack and fly around the packed, albeit small, map that it calls it's home, or would you rather drop peasant goats from the sky as the queen of all that is goaty? Want to imbue the powers of the Goat Devil himself into a singularity of goat *I mean out"* of this world proportions? You can do that. Or just interested in floppin' it up with the new-fangled "ragdoll-key"? Why not?!  When it comes to it

reviewText: SINCE THE DAWN OF THE INTERNETS. Mankind has sought a way in which to simulate the life of a goat. They said it couldn't be done! But, after years of science fiction movies about goat simulator video games we have finally reached the apex of civilization: goat simluator 2014. Eons from now when mankind is long extinct and archeaologists from an alien species are excavating our ruins to piece together what kind of culture we had it is my belief that Goat Simulator 2014 will be the key artifact that redeems our species and convinces them to take DNA from mosquitoes frozen in tree sap in order to clone humans and let us live in their intergalactic zoo forever. Oh theres also a jetpack....

reviewText: I would just like to say, before I begin, that yes, I think this is the greatest game of all time. There is no other game in the entire universe, from now until the end of time that will compare to the greatness that is this game.\n\nYou may say to yourself My my
date: this is a big claim you're making. Exactly what is it about this game that makes it so great?". Well
recommended: let me tell you a story.\n\nBack when I was 11 years old
hoursPlayed: I was at school (bear in mind it was a rural area too
voteText: so there was lots of fields and farm animals around). I was in class
helpfulPercent: staring out the window
votesHelpful: distracting myself from the boring lessons I had to endure. Sometimes
votesTotal: I would stare out into the fields and sky
votesFunny: contemplating what it would feel like to be out there
commentsCount: totally free to run around as a goat. I often pretended I was a goat at home
column16: when I was alone in my beadroom
column17: running around in circles destroying all of my toys
column18: video games and things in my closet. This felt like it was representing the urge to release myself from the house I was living in and roam around in nature with all the other animals.\n\nFor about 10 years since then
column19: I was told to suppress my urge to become a goat. My parents didn't want to continuously purchase new toys and games for me to play with (which in hindsight was fair enough too
column20: considering they would break every time I acted like a goat)
column21: and during that time
column22: I felt alone. No one was around to understand how I felt. The urge to run around completely naked as a goat
column23: breaking everything
column24: was all but a distant memory
column25: a shadow of my former self that I regretted to have. For a time
column26:
I nearly forgot about doing it at all.

That was until this game came along.

I played it
column27: and played and played it. It changed by life. All the old feelings and urges came flooding back to me as soon as I started licking cars as they drive by. The wrecking of people's houses reminding me of those times as a kid when I would do the same thing in my bedroom. It felt like the developers truly understood how I feel
column28: after all these years searching for someone who had the same hopes and dreams as me.\n\nAs a result of playing this game
column29: I have now started organizing meetups at night for likeminded people
column30: and we run on all fours throughout the night
column31: around the fields near my old school amongst other goats. Luckily we can get away with making goat noises when we're surrounded by them. No one seems to notice
column34: we can run through our nearest city as goats at some point
column35: even if it's in goat costumes.\n\nAnd that is why I think this is the greatest game of all time. If anyone at Coffee Stain Studios reads this
column36: I am personally thanking you for becoming an inspiration for me to create the new 'Goaty' fandom.\n\nSincerely

reviewText:
We all waited patiently. We knew the day would come. Even from the beginning when we blew our NES cartridges or played at the video arcade, we knew one day a game would be released that would change our perception of the world forever.

But there was one problem. There were no words in the english language complex enough to describe what we saw in our visions. We could not communicate with each other about the details. The world waited in darkness.

Finally the day has come and we can say the words we were always looking for.

Goat. Simulator.

reviewText: Pac-Man Championship Edition seemed like the perfect Xbox Live Arcade game when it arrived back in 2007 -- but an even better version is now available on PlayStation Network. Somehow, gaming's oldest mascot is delivering one of the most exciting games of the year. More mazes, more modes, more ghosts...lots more ghosts, actually. This deluxe" version takes everything that made Championship Edition great and adds a bunch of cool new stuff. It's like taking a great white shark and adding laser beam eyes and saw blades that shoot out of its mouth.\n\nPac-Man Championship Edition DX is all about gunning for a high score. Games are timed
date: so you need to eat as many pellets
hoursPlayed: and ghosts as possible before the clock stops. You don't die as often as you did in the original Pac-Man
voteText: you earn plenty of extra lives
helpfulPercent: and you have many bombs at your disposal to get out of tight spots. (Yes
votesHelpful: Pac-Man can now trigger bombs that send all of the ghosts back to their hideout.) Without much fear of death
votesTotal: you can focus on the one thing that matters: representing on the online score boards.\n\nPac-Man now has many more ghosts to contend with. Like
votesFunny: a hundred more. You'll see the spirits sleeping around a maze
commentsCount: and as Pac-Man whizzes by they'll wake up and give chase. Hold off on eating a Power Pellet long enough and you may find dozens of ghosts trailing behind you in a long conga line. Finally grabbing that Power Pellet and devouring a hundred ghosts in a row is one of the most satisfying things I've done in a game this year. This is also a key technique in getting those high scores.\n\nWhile the first Championship Edition was super fun
column16: there were only a couple of mazes and modes. DX has nine mazes
column17: most of which are new creations that offer a lot of variety. For example
column18: Spiral has several coils that are easy to get trapped in. Dungeon
column19: on the other hand
column20: has long
column21: cramped corridors. Each maze also has many game options such as Score Attack
column22: Time Trials
column23: and Ghost Combos (see how many ghosts you can eat with one Power Pellet). When you first dive into Championship Edition DX
column24: only the standard Championship II course is unlocked
column25: but each round you play usually unlocks a new maze or mode.\n\nLike I said
column26: it's all about the high score
column27: and Championship Edition DX provides many friendly ways to see how you rank against the competition. You can comb through the leaderboards for extensive data on all the many maps and modes
column28: but there are other really nice touches: your current ranking is displayed right on the title screen
column30: and again within the menu for each maze.\n\nPac-Man Championship Edition DX also looks and sounds great. You can select from a variety of maze skins and character designs for each game
column31:
running from the 3D Pac-Mania characters to pixilated retro sprites. The lively electronic soundtrack builds in intensity as the game timer ticks down and always gets me leaning forward in my chair.

THE VERDICT
Pac-Man Championship Edition DX boasts simple
column32: addictive gameplay that will have you competing for high scores on the score boards for months. Everything that made the first game a hit is still here
column33: accompanied by a bunch of new mazes
column35: and ghosts -- all for $10. It's hard to imagine a more perfect PlayStation Network game. This is a master class in game design: you will understand it instantly
column37:
and want to play again and again.

reviewText: A masterfully done metphor that contemplates our place in the universe.  Goats.  Our world pays so little homage to this creature, but this game does such a perfect job as to underline the importance of it in our modern world.  This game does an amazing job at answering important questions pertaining to life, the universe, and everything.\nThe game itself is nothing short of a masterpiece.  Out of the plethora of games in the genre, this is, by far, the best goat simulation game I've ever played.  The realism in it is absolutely stunning, from the revolutionary next-gen graphics to the pinpointed level of realism achieved.  Goat Simulator is a must-play for any gamer, as well as anyone else, human or goat.

reviewText:
We all waited patiently. We knew the day would come. Even from the beginning when we blew our NES cartridges or played at the video arcade, we knew one day a game would be released that would change our perception of the world forever.

But there was one problem. There were no words in the english language complex enough to describe what we saw in our visions. We could not communicate with each other about the details. The world waited in darkness.

Finally the day has come and we can say the words we were always looking for.

Goat. Simulator.

reviewText: Pac-Man Championship Edition seemed like the perfect Xbox Live Arcade game when it arrived back in 2007 -- but an even better version is now available on PlayStation Network. Somehow, gaming's oldest mascot is delivering one of the most exciting games of the year. More mazes, more modes, more ghosts...lots more ghosts, actually. This deluxe" version takes everything that made Championship Edition great and adds a bunch of cool new stuff. It's like taking a great white shark and adding laser beam eyes and saw blades that shoot out of its mouth.\n\nPac-Man Championship Edition DX is all about gunning for a high score. Games are timed
date: so you need to eat as many pellets
hoursPlayed: and ghosts as possible before the clock stops. You don't die as often as you did in the original Pac-Man
voteText: you earn plenty of extra lives
helpfulPercent: and you have many bombs at your disposal to get out of tight spots. (Yes
votesHelpful: Pac-Man can now trigger bombs that send all of the ghosts back to their hideout.) Without much fear of death
votesTotal: you can focus on the one thing that matters: representing on the online score boards.\n\nPac-Man now has many more ghosts to contend with. Like
votesFunny: a hundred more. You'll see the spirits sleeping around a maze
commentsCount: and as Pac-Man whizzes by they'll wake up and give chase. Hold off on eating a Power Pellet long enough and you may find dozens of ghosts trailing behind you in a long conga line. Finally grabbing that Power Pellet and devouring a hundred ghosts in a row is one of the most satisfying things I've done in a game this year. This is also a key technique in getting those high scores.\n\nWhile the first Championship Edition was super fun
column16: there were only a couple of mazes and modes. DX has nine mazes
column17: most of which are new creations that offer a lot of variety. For example
column18: Spiral has several coils that are easy to get trapped in. Dungeon
column19: on the other hand
column20: has long
column21: cramped corridors. Each maze also has many game options such as Score Attack
column22: Time Trials
column23: and Ghost Combos (see how many ghosts you can eat with one Power Pellet). When you first dive into Championship Edition DX
column24: only the standard Championship II course is unlocked
column25: but each round you play usually unlocks a new maze or mode.\n\nLike I said
column26: it's all about the high score
column27: and Championship Edition DX provides many friendly ways to see how you rank against the competition. You can comb through the leaderboards for extensive data on all the many maps and modes
column28: but there are other really nice touches: your current ranking is displayed right on the title screen
column30: and again within the menu for each maze.\n\nPac-Man Championship Edition DX also looks and sounds great. You can select from a variety of maze skins and character designs for each game
column31:
running from the 3D Pac-Mania characters to pixilated retro sprites. The lively electronic soundtrack builds in intensity as the game timer ticks down and always gets me leaning forward in my chair.

THE VERDICT
Pac-Man Championship Edition DX boasts simple
column32: addictive gameplay that will have you competing for high scores on the score boards for months. Everything that made the first game a hit is still here
column33: accompanied by a bunch of new mazes
column35: and ghosts -- all for $10. It's hard to imagine a more perfect PlayStation Network game. This is a master class in game design: you will understand it instantly
column37:
and want to play again and again.

reviewText: Goat Simulator is a lot of fun, it's filled with amazing bugs and glitches, it's got a lot of secrets to it to discover and it's the first single-player game I've had the most fun with for a while. It's a bit pricey, however, what I don't think people understand is that there are going to be a few free updates with more content and there is a workshop and a full SDK for the game. The workshop is slowly getting content and a new update is going to be in May including a new map. I've completed every challenge and gained every achievement, yet I find myself coming back to the game even after 18 hours. If you are willing to give a bit of cash to support some independent developers and to have fun and laugh at some incredible glitches I'd say buy this game.

reviewText: Goat Simulator is a very difficult game for me to review. There's just so many good things about it, and so many bad things about it. Essentially, as a full-blown game, I can't really recommend it. But as a toy akin to Little Inferno, something that you just start up in your spare time for a quick romp, I have to say it's probably the best in the business.\n\nLet's start with overall gameplay. There isn't much variety in what you can do, but what you can do is just downright fabulous. The whole game" is pretty much a "mess around with physics" thing. You can go around and headbutt/kick people around
date: watch bodies spaz out and/or fly around
recommended: and you can even use your super-strength tongue to grab a hold of almost everything. You could latch onto a car and run around with it! Pretty much everything you can do results in you getting points for certain quests or for the sake of getting points. Do a flip? There's some points. Blow up a gas station? There's some points for that. Sacrifice a robot to Satan? Well here's some points for your troubles. There's a few fun items strewn out around the map
hoursPlayed: like a few fireworks that launch you up into the air
voteText: and a treadmill for a little excruciating workout. There's also a ton of trampolines/matresses to bounce around on. Frankly
helpfulPercent: I spent more time bouncing around on trampolines than anything else in the "game". You've also got a handful of quests that span from getting a large score
votesHelpful: a large score combo
votesTotal: or just finding locations/trophies. Obviously
votesFunny: these quests are finished fairly quickly with the exception of the score quests
commentsCount: which don't take much effort
column16: especially if you've unlocked the Angel goat.\n\nFortunately
column17: if you're bored with tossing civilians down water slides and blowing up cars
column18: there's a bunch of mini-missions for you to do as well! These mini-missions range from sacrificing humans to Satan to goat sumo wrestling. There aren't many
column19: though
column20: and they don't last long
column21: but there's 2 more noteable mini-missions that could keep you playing longer than you intended to. The 2 mini-missions being Time Trial and Flappy Goat. The goal of Time Trial is to get as many points as you can (in normal goat form). Sounds fun
column22: but one run only lasts about 60 seconds. And in normal goat form
column23: you can't really do much other than basic flips and/or crashing into a ton of stuff. The second mini-mission (really more of a minigame) is Flappy Goat
column24: or as I like to call it
column25: proof that the developers hate you. I swear
column26: Flappy Goat was designed just to cause pain to completionists everywhere. It's just so horribly done
column27: the hitbox on the goat is downright terrible
column28: and the gravity is just too harsh. Pair those 2 problems up with Flappy Bird gameplay and you've got yourself a headache. The worst part is
column29: the developers added an achievement where you have to get 10 points on Flappy Goat. It may not seem too hard
column30: but I've spent 2 hours myself trying to get that achievement. I swear
column31: if there was anything to make me absolutely HATE goat simulator
column32: it was Flappy Goat.\n\nMoving on to the goat itself. The goat has some basic abilities. Left click is headbutt/kick (when moving backwards)
column34: which attaches your tongue to whatever object you were looking at
column35: and lets you drag it around. Q forces the goat to go into ragdoll mode. I absolutely love this feature
column36: as playing around with ragdolls in games like Garry's Mod and GTA 4 was how I spent most of my time. And it's much better in this game. I absolutely love tossing myself at whatever and going ragdoll just to see what happens. But my absolute favorite function of the goats is the bleat button. You press 1
column37: and the goat bleats. It's pretty cool. Press it a few more times
column38: he bleats like a normal goat would. Now you're having fun acting like a real goat. Press the 1 button a few more times
column39: and you start hearing some weird stuff. The goat starts emitting booming roars and human-like screams. Now
column40: it's downright hilarious. You jump off a high place
column42: and you hear a human scream as your goat is plummeting down
column43: and you can't control your laughter. It's a hilarious feature and I'm extremely glad that the developers added it in. It almost makes up for Flappy Goat.\n\nThen there's the goat modifiers. The goat modifiers either gives you a special item or a new look. These goat modifiers can be earned in several ways. A few of them can be earned by completing certain mini-missions
column44: and some can be earned by finding a certain amount of trophies. I also believe a few are unlocked from the start. I won't spoil any of them

column53: I wouldn't have a problem. But as it stands
column54: the main map isn't anything special. Fortunately
column55: the game also comes with workshop support
column56: where you can download player-made goats
column60: so the game does feel much more fleshed out than I previously thought. But
column62: the workshop for a game like this is really both a good and bad thing. It's good that a game like this is given tools so that players that want to add more CAN add more. But at the same time
column63: if you took out workshop support
column64: the game would only probably have a total of 3-4 hours of playtime total before people get bored. I feel as though the developers only added workshop support for this game because they got lazy
column65: effectively making the players develop the rest of their game for them. I can't say that that would be a fact
column66: but it seems to make enough sense.\n\nBefore I wrap up the review
column67: I wanted to point out one simple feature on this game that I absolutely loved. This game has a legitimate text-to-speech feature with no dumb filter (like Moonbase Alpha). It's hilarious having it act as a narrative as you go around smashing into things.\n\nOverall
column68: the whole game is pretty fun. I've already played it for several hours (upon posting this
column69: which is written a day after the release). You can easily get hooked on this game because of the stupid physics alone. Just spending time on the water slides/trampolines is enough for a solid hour of fun. If you want a neat little time waster
column70: I would definitely recommend this game. The price for this toy feels right as well
column71: being at $10. I would definitely say at that price it's well worth it."

reviewText:
When I first laid eyes on this game, it was April 1st 2014 and I was highly amused by Steam's version of an April Fool's joke; because, a goat simulator, come on! However, it did puzzle me how much work they had put into the delightful screencaps, and it almost seemed real and ready to buy. (Needless to say; I was even more puzzled when the game remained in the store even after April 1st.)
Then, some months later, a friend recommended it to me, and when it was on sale, I thought; okay, why not?
Now I should mention that I am a busy student and have my library filled with unfinished games because I have barely time to play. And at the time when I bought Goat Simulator, I hadn't played anything for more than an hour in a while.
I bought Goat Simulator, with the MMO Simulator already implemented, and whoa, in the first week I managed to play 26 hours in total; easily surpassing my general playtime over the past months. I was hooked. And I remain hooked.
10/10

reviewText:
There are a lot of silly simulator games out there, and this is one of them. Some of the silly ones were good, even Surgeon Simulator was good, because it was silly and funny, but it was also actually slightly difficult, and was actaully a game. This game is not really that difficult, but it does have some good and bad traits to it. You can play as an animal, which is awesome! There are a lot of hard achievements to get (as well as some very easy ones), and it's a stupid simulator game.

You can play as an animal in this game, which I love. It's so hard to find games in which you can play as an animal, and that is the reason I bought this game in the first place, and in the terms of playing as an animal it really fufills it's goal. Not only can you play as a goat, but you can also play as a dinosaur, a penguin, a giraffe and a whale. As whatever you play, you can make noises and act as an animal destroying things.

The achievements can be quite difficult or quite easy, the early achievements are obviously very easy, but as in any game, they get harder.Checking the achievement stats, you can see that a lot of people haven't gotten qutie a few easy achievements, which makes it clear the people who play this game don't play it for the achievements. The big problem with the achievements are that you cannot get all of them unless you buy the other DLC for this game, such as the 'GoatZ' one, or the 'Payday 2' one. When there was just one DLC it was fine, but now they have released a lot more stupid DLC that has made it harder and harder to get more of the achievements. Having all the achievements to collect makes it more and more fun to replay the game and try and get the achievements.

This is obviously a stupid simulator game, but you don't always need to play it as one. No matter what the game, you are always the one who chooses to play the game a certain way, no one is forcing you to play this game in a stupid way, and headbutt things, and go all ragdoll everywhere. You are playing the game like that, and there's nothing wrong with playing the game like that, as it is a sandbox game. But there's also nothing wrong with trying to get all the achievements, it's just another way to play. But despite all that, it is a stupid simulator game, and that also means it has  a lot of spontanious references to mainstream things, like Minecraft, The Hitch Hikers Guide To The Galaxy, and deadmau5. These references are at first slightly funny, as it's a reference that you know and it's in a game. But at the same time it's about as funny as Saints Row 3 or 4, it's the type of funny that is splewn across the later Saints Rows games, it's not as funny as it would have been if it was a more serious game, but with the references still in there. Having a more serious game with small funny things works more than a funny game with funny things.

In the end, I can't recommend this game, as this game only draws in people who just want to experience something spontanious, and not by people who want achievements (because of the low stats) and most likely not by people who like playing animals in games (as there isn't as much of a demand for those games). If you want to play a simulator game for the silliness of the game, you could play Surgeon Simulator, as it is a much more fun game, a game with references and still a lot more difficult to play than Goat Simulator. Although this game can be quite fun to play multiplayer, so unless you want to paly an animal, collect achievements or play multiplayer, then you should not buy this game, as it gets old quickley.

reviewText:
Its funny they said. You will enjoy it they said.

This is the worst waste of my time and my money on my Steam account. This game doesn't deserve the praise its gotten.
It started a revolution when developers realized you could make more money of a buggy 'hilarious' game than you could a triple a title, and thus cascaded the Steam store with cringeworthy garbage. Unlike Surgeon Simulator and I Am Bread, Goat Simulator has no point, or any goal to get to, and no trials or obstacles to pass. You just knock stuff around and laugh probably once. (Thats being generous.) This game was made for the sole purpose of profiting off autists, and it suceeded distastefully.

This game is the bane of my existance and I wish I could give it more negative reviews than one. Do yourself a favor, don't buy it.

reviewText: Before buying the game, i researched online the specs for Goat Simulator - my laptop is fairly low end - to check if my computer could run it. System Requirements Lab told me that i could easily run the game with the recommended specifications, so i bought it. However, when I played the game it was very laggy and i could not run it at all without putting every setting to low and turning off lighting effects and shaders - and even then the frame rate doesn't rise above 15.This hasn't just happened to me, as i have found multiple forums on people talking about this issue. Don't buy this game unless you have a high end computer.

reviewText:
This game sucks.
Yes yes, it's an april fools joke, I understand, I have some humour. But ten euros for this disaster is just overpriced and it's one of the top selling games already for a week just because youtubers play it.
So, there are multiple factors that make this game an abomination.

The bugs, this game is one of the buggiest games I've ever seen, when you start to play it it is so funny HAHA THAT GOAT DOES FUNNY HAHA, but after a half hour all the jokes in this game become very repetitive and plain annoying. You can't walk without tripping over anything and then you have to wait until your goat stands up again, and three seconds later he's on the ground again. Also, when you're trying to do something it happens sometimes that you fly all over to the other side of the map because of a random programmed bug. And other situations are that you're trying to get on a roof for a trophy for the achievements, but you keep falling through the roof and then you have to climb up all your way back. And don't get me started on the bug that some 3d models like cars or trampolines don't appear until you're close to them.

The controls, the controls are so annoying, your goat goes most of the time for no reason in muscles off" mode

reviewText:
This game...  this game right here changed me from doesn't even care about goats into I LOVE goats and wish that they could actually do all of the chaos that this game has.

There is a LOT of things to do in this game. I mean, you get to sacrifice humans what gets better than that?!  You get to headbutt people, do frontflips, fall off of buildings and survive, lick things and carry whatever you licked with you, lots of hidden objectives to do, turn into different types of goat, and etc etc.

In conclusion, most hilarious game I've ever played. I have no idea how many drugs they were on before they created it, but it is on my top ten game list. If you havn't heard or played this game I'm very disapointed in you. It is definatly worth the money and is a must play game.

BUY IT AND PLAY IT!!!!!

reviewText:
PROS: A smallish map with a LOT to explore and the goals make the game more than just a mess-around game (although it really is that in the first place) and the fact that it is supposed to be buggy makes the game that much more hilarious. With the golden goat trophies this game makes my day. You can become [SPOILER ALERT]  a flipping sperm whale and flop around the map or even an alien from Sanctum 2 (it kinda looks like a bug giraffe thing) . There are many other goats you can be if you collect enough golden goat statues. This game even has workshop support, so if you get bored of the normal goats or the original map or even just want more abilities for custom games, then you can get an item from the workshop or make your own. For such a small map, the place is flipping packed with easter eggs (such as the golden goat trophies) and, my favorite, a cool robot dude in a storage crate held up by the crane and [SPOILER ALERT]  If you get certain achievments you can actually be the robot!  And on the side, there are many references to other games like Coffee Stain Studio's game Sanctum 2 and Flappy bird.

CONS: The fact that they are only removing bugs that crash the game means that there will always be bugs. Always. Sometimes I find myself getting stuck on a rock and glitching underground. I still would like the bugs there but some of them are just plain irritating. The game also requires a pretty good graphics card, so make sure your computer isn't a potato and the game doesn't eat your computer. I had to turn my settings all the way down and only then did most of the lag go away. Another thing is that the Flappy Bird game (Flappy Goat) is the most rage inducing thing in the ENTIRE game. To unlock the achievment for the Flappy Goat you needed to score ten and my high score is like six. And the reason it is hard is because the hitbox of the goat is bigger than the goat itself so you end up hitting something when it looks like you didn't. And with some of the goats like the space goat for example, its a lot harder to know where your headbutting because you dont hit where your head goes, you hit right in front of you so it kinda seems a bit akward, but hopefully they will fix it. The game is still in development so all the bad stuff right now will probably be fixed in the future and new stuff will be added.


Overall I give this game a 11/10. Apart from the bugs which they are never going to fix (which isn't really that bad) and some akward hitboxes this game is virtual gold. Mostly because the bad and irritating things about this game don't bother me as much as it would with other people. If you are looking for a good laugh, a goat with jelly legs, and a cool game to play with your friends at home  (They are planning to add local co-op)   then this is the game for you!*


*This game is Chuck Norris approved

reviewText:
Well, where do I start. I managed to play this goat specticle on a friends account .

Upon seeing this game I thouht to myself how sad , but to be honest a part of my life is now complete , not only can I be a goat, I can be a super goat. I have the most powerful headbut the world has ever seen, as well performing amazing aerobatics ., while doing these wonderful feats of strength and grace , my tounge is hanging out like when you see a stunning woman walk past. you can lick the surroundings clean, another interesting thing about this game is the way you climb ladders , you literatly bite the ladder step , hopefully not catching your Goat licker 3000 inbetween your teeth and the ladder rung.  One of the best parts of the game is baa ing , not only can you install fear into all humans, goats and petrol tankers and stations , you can attract them with you very subtle Baa , which actually sounds like a little lamb.

Over all a day in the life of a goat is not complete , I wish the developers would have put the option to eat and poop , just to make the exeprience complete.

All I can say is if you want to be a goat and can't get to a farm, a onsie or a  costume this is the next bext thing. I hope you all enjoy this wonderful priveldge of been a goat , at  least you wont be milked and chased :P

reviewText: Do you one day dream of growing up to be a professional goat? Well guess what, this game's the closest thing to the real deal you'll possibly find. You like grazing in the field? reviewText: It's not just a simulation, it's a journey. Through this groundbreaking simulation we are transformed; able to repercieve and refine our own lives through the experience of partaking of the essence of another lifeform. Some may see only a goat, but we become more. We surpass the mundane. We become the goat elivened with dreams, fantasies, and aspirations. Through the goat we become free to live out any and all freedoms this sumulated life grants us, free from disarming and constricting social bonds. As I partake of the simulation, I find myself overcome by the enlightenment granted by multiple and sometimes conflicting perceptions of the self. I am reminded that consciousness as we know it is infused throughout reality. I am redeemed. I am reborn. A solid 7/10.

reviewText: Goat Simulator is a joke of a game. It‚Äôs small, deliberately unpolished and buggy, and its design is simple. So it‚Äôs a good thing it‚Äôs a really funny joke, full of great physics-powered slapstick humor, and unexpected surprises in every corner of its seemingly peaceful small-town map. There‚Äôs not much actual gameplay here beyond breaking things for points, but shooting for a high score is probably the least entertaining thing about Goat Simulator. It‚Äôs mostly about exploring the fun house and discovering the hilarious surprises at your own pace.

reviewText:
This game is simply genious!
Emphasis on simple.

Despite the game being made as a quick joke for April Fools, it still keeps you laughing for hours as you explore a small suburban area as a crazed goat who is above the law. Graze in the fields, attempt to run on a treadmill, trash a picnic, or just plain out cause all hell to break loose as you ruin lives and cause massive property damage in this silly game.

reviewText: A truly sad game tapping in to your emotions. I am glad I ever purchased this aboslutely fine piece of art. reviewText: Have you ever wanted to be a goat? Well I sure have. Today you can finally become a goat that is still recovering from getting in a car crash and breaking his legs. Well if that doesn't convince you, have you ever just wanted to run into a man at full speed and kill him automatically without getting arrested? Well now you can. Even if there were cops in this game you could use the mechanics of licking him and just fly him across the map and he'll never be seen again. Have you ever wanted to drive a harvester and kill innocent civilians? Well too bad. Oh, I forgot to mention, as of right now I am holding onto a man hang gliding with just my tongue. This has to be the best goat simulator out there. It isn't like any other, and I highly recommend it. 10/10 Bahhhhs.

reviewText:
Moment of real talk here. Is it ten US dollars good? In terms of content volume, stability, polish, structure, and consistency, on those very descriptors alone, no.

However, this game basically tells us here in 2014 that, in the end, we just want to have fun. This game is fun. For how long it's fun is up to you. Even so, there is a definite primal reaction this game elicits that will tell all but the most jaded, or those who seriously crave structure, that yes, you are having fun. You are enjoying this nonsense. It wants nothing more than for you to just go forth and have fun discovering weird things and wreak havoc in ways where you may not always be in precise control, but you are probably enjoying it just for what silliness goes on by your hand (or tongue).

It's a novelty, but it is also a powerful statement for the curiosity it is. There's a reason people wanted to play this, and it wasn't brand name, or celebrity voice actors, or any sort of technological prowess to show off the day's advanced hardware. It was because it looked fun, and I believe their expectations - and mine - have been met. If you just want to press WASD and be the rudest tourist visiting human society possible in the process, you will have fun.

That should be the quality we take into account most of all with any of these games.
